explanation:
To determine whether the shown function uses any compiler language extensions (MISRA rule check) the next analyzer must inspect all identifiers and macros whose definitions could hide non-standard constructs. Specifically:
- OS_OBJECT_TABLE_GET (macro definition): The macro expands in-place; it is the most likely place for compiler extensions (statement-expressions, typeof, __extension__, GCC asm, nested statements). Must inspect full macro body.
- OS_impl_timebase_table and OS_timebase_table (declarations): These symbols may be macros or variables whose declarations/initializers could use extensions or attributes; the macro above may reference them.
- OS_impl_timebase_internal_record_t (type definition): Needed to inspect the impl->sigset and impl->reset_flag members — their types/definitions might use extensions (bit-fields with non-standard widths, attributes, packed/transparent unions, compiler-specific pragmas).
- OS_timebase_internal_record_t (type definition): Needed to inspect nominal_interval_time and nominal_start_time member types (could be typedefs using extensions or unusual attributes).
- OS_object_token_t (typedef/definition): Token representation could be a complex macro/union/struct that uses extensions; macros that operate on tokens may rely on extensions.
- osal_id_t (typedef): The parameter type could be an alias to a compiler-specific type or use attributes; must confirm it is a standard typedef.
- uint32 (typedef): Non-standard integer alias — verify it is a plain typedef (e.g., to uint32_t/unsigned int) and not a compiler extension.
- OS_ObjectIdGetById (declaration/implementation and any related macros): The call site could expand to inline functions or macros that use extensions (attributes, statement expressions, typeof). Inspect its body/definition and any helper macros (ObjectIdTransactionInit/ToArrayIndex/ConvertToken etc.) for extensions.
- OS_SUCCESS (macro/constant): Value itself is not an extension, but verify it is a simple constant and not a macro wrapping an expression with extensions.
- OS_LOCK_MODE_NONE and OS_OBJECT_TYPE_OS_TIMEBASE (macros/constants): These macros may be defined in terms of other macros or expressions that use extensions — inspect definitions.
- sigwait (prototype) and sigset_t (type): External library prototypes/types could use non-standard extensions or macros; confirm usage is standard POSIX and that sigwait is declared in standard headers included by the project.

Collecting these definitions lets the next agent expand macros and inspect type/definition bodies to detect any use of compiler-specific language extensions (GCC/clang attributes, statement-expressions, typeof, asm, nested functions, extension pragmas, etc.).
